page.title: 12THE HONORARY POLICE
page.content:
My Dad is a Constable's Officer. He has a full time job in an office in St. Helier but for one week every month he is on duty as a member of the honorary police of the parish of St. Brelade's. He doesn't get paid for the job, he does it voluntarily.
He goes out on duty from 8.00 pm-1.00 am. Sometimes he comes home with blood on his shirt, it is normally from teen agers having a fight. Also when he goes out at night he makes sure there are no cars parked where they should not be. If there are he will write out a ticket and place it on the window screen. He also gets called out on special occasions, perhaps to direct the traffic at a wedding. My Dad is very proud to be a C.O.
